greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Powerfree kernel of cubefree part of n.
comment: If n=Product[Pj^Ej] then a(n)=Product[Pj^Fj], where Fj=0 if Ej is 0 or a multiple of 3 and Fj=1 otherwise.
Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^(if 3|e, then 0, else 1). - _Mitch Harris_, Apr 19 2005
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(32)=2 because cubefree part of 32 is 4 and powerfree kernel of 4 is 2.
mathematica: f[p_, e_] :=  p^If[Divisible[e, 3], 0, 1]; a[n_] := Times @@ (f @@@ FactorInteger[ n]); Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Aug 29 2019 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n)); for (k=1, #f~, if (frac(f[k,2]/3), f[k,2] = 1, f[k,2] = 0)); factorback(f); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 28 2019
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jun 25 2000
